str2: From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To collect, gather. From sun and lego in its original sense; to collect.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A thorn-bush, prickly plant; a thorn. Probably from the same as akmen; a thorn.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A (ripe) fig. Apparently a primary word; a fig.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A thistle. From treis and belos; properly, a crow-foot, i.e. a thorny plant.
